Package reader

Class ExcelReader

java.lang.Object
reader.ExcelReader
public class ExcelReader extends Object
The ExcelReader class is used to to create and deal with an ArrayList<Line> from an excel file path, and compare Code Smells given another excel file path

Since:
1.0
See Also:
Line, Rule

    Description

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    static String[][]
    compareCodeSmells​(ArrayList<reader.Line> lines, String comparisonFilePath)
    Given an ArrayList of Lines and a file path, returns a String matrix, comparing the boolean value of each Rule on Line.getMetrics().
    static int[]
    getProjectStats​(ArrayList<reader.Line> lines)
    Given an ArrayList of Lines, returns an int vector identifying the number of different Line.getPkg(), and Line.getCls(), the size of the list, and the sum of the Line.getMetrics().get("LOC_class").
    static ArrayList<reader.Line>
    readExcelFile​(String fileToImport)
    Given an excel file path, returns an ArrayList of Lines from the excel table.

  • Method Details

    • readExcelFile

      public static ArrayList<reader.Line> readExcelFile​(String fileToImport)
      Given an excel file path, returns an ArrayList of Lines from the excel table.
      Parameters:
      fileToImport - a String standing for an excel file path
      Returns:
      an ArrayList of Lines from the excel file
      See Also:
      XSSFWorkbook, XSSFSheet, Cell, Row, Iterator, FileInputStream, File

    • getProjectStats

      public static int[] getProjectStats​(ArrayList<reader.Line> lines)
      Given an ArrayList of Lines, returns an int vector identifying the number of different Line.getPkg(), and Line.getCls(), the size of the list, and the sum of the Line.getMetrics().get("LOC_class").
      Parameters:
      lines - an ArrayList of Lines
      Returns:
      an int vector
      See Also:
      HelperMethods, ArrayList

    • compareCodeSmells

      public static String[][] compareCodeSmells​(ArrayList<reader.Line> lines, String comparisonFilePath)
      Given an ArrayList of Lines and a file path, returns a String matrix, comparing the boolean value of each Rule on Line.getMetrics(). If the boolean value is true-true, adds "VP" to the matrix, else if true-false, adds "FP", else if false-true, adds "FN", else if false-false, adds "VN", else, adds "NA".
      Parameters:
      lines - an ArrayList of Lines
      comparisonFilePath - a String standing for an excel file path
      Returns:
      a String matrix
      Since:
      2.0
      See Also:
      ArrayList, LinkedList, HelperMethods
